title: Communication Skills: Be One-on-One Ready / Techniques de communication : Soyez prêt pour vos rencontres individuelles
description:
For individual contributors only.

Enhance your communication skills with Be One-on-One Ready workshop

Designed to complement our new Performance and Development Program, this interactive one-day workshop will give you the confidence and know-how to have meaningful performance conversations with your leader

Learning Objectives:

This highly interactive program will provide you with the opportunity to discover how to:
• Increase your self-awareness about your strengths and passions at work
• Leverage the Bank’s Core Competencies to build your performance success
• Enhance your communication skills to fully engage in performance and development discussions with your leader
• Explore how to more concretely build trust with your leader
• Structure a meaningful performance conversation with your leader
• Enhance your professional development plan
• Boost your level of engagement at work

title: Contributing to Change (Core Competency) / Notre part de progrès (Compétences clés)
description:
Because change is inevitable, taking an active role in it is critical – for your success and the success of the organization. Successful participation in the change process depends on agile development and your ability to be future oriented, seize external opportunities and bounce back from unforeseen changes.
In this interactive session you will learn how to participate in change initiatives while understanding and managing your own responses to change. As a result of participating in this session, you will be well equipped to manage your responses to sudden and ongoing change, enabling optimal productivity and maximum benefits in your work environment.


HOW YOU WILL BENEFIT:
- Embrace or reconcile the reality of change, address and decrease anxiety,
and concentrate on productivity and results
- Establish your profile within your organization as one that can manage
change and demonstrates agility and resilience
- Set a positive example for colleagues or direct reports when handling
significant changes in the workplace

title: Effective Communication Skills (Core Competency) / Aptitudes efficaces de communication (Compétences clés)
description:
Gain recognition, build stronger work relationships and deliver high-value results!
Effective communication is demonstrated through taking the responsibility to communicate new ideas, innovations and better ways to get the work accomplished. This ability is especially crucial during times of economic uncertainty, where responsibilities can change unexpectedly and fresh ideas and input are essential at all organizational levels.
This program offers practical and adaptive strategies for communicating your message to a variety of audiences - to inform and influence others no matter where they fit in the organizational chart.


LEARNING OBJECTIVES
• Acquire behaviours and techniques that demonstrate a strong sense of self-confidence
with your peers, direct reports and manager
• Develop techniques to analyse audiences and situations appropriately
• Create processes to frame your message to specific audiences
• Apply strategies to influence and motivate others

title: Security Awareness | Sensibilisation à la sécurité
description:
This module explains the Corporate Security Policy, and describes security responsibilities, including what we must do to comply. Estimated completion time: 18 minutes. 

*****

Ce module présente la Politique de sécurité de la Banque et explique les responsabilités en matière de sécurité, y compris ce que nous devons faire pour nous y conformer. Durée approximative de la formation : 18 minutes.

title: Problem Solving with an Innovative Mindset (Core Competency) / Régler les problèmes grâce à un esprit novateur (Compétences clés)
description:
Problem Solving with an Innovative Mindset

In this 1-day interactive workshop, you will learn how to contribute to continuous improvement at the Bank and build your toolkit to challenge the status quo constructively.


	Learn to identify the strengths and opportunities of your current innovation mindset.
	Understand how to innovate within the Bank’s risk appetite.
	Use a gap analysis to define the current state versus the desired state.
	Apply tools to assess the situation accurately and set clear goals.
	Find out about techniques for creatively generating ideas and solutions.
	Use tools to select which ideas and solutions merit your attention.

title: Emerging Leaders’ Assessment Workshop / Atelier sur le niveau de préparation des leaders en devenir
description:
This 2-day virtual program is intended for those that have an interest in developing towards a leadership role at the Bank.  The workshop includes a leadership readiness assessment; an overview of what it means to be a leader at the Bank; and tips on how to develop the necessary skills.

Following the workshop, participants will be encouraged to discuss the outcome of the session with their leader and may be selected to attend the Bank’s 3-day Emerging Leaders’ Development Program.

title: Emerging Leader Development Program / Le Programme de perfectionnement des leaders en devenir
description:
The Emerging Leader Development Program is a set of foundational courses that provide individuals with a powerful set of interaction skills that enables them to communicate more effectively, build trust, strengthen partnerships, and achieve results.

Through this program you will learn about the challenges new leaders face and ways to effectively manage them. The program explores subjects like dealing with conflict, making decisions, strategies for influencing others, and networking. A comprehensive development plan will be created based on an assessment of leadership potential and discussions during the training.

title: Take Action: Be a Self-Starter (Core Competency) / Passez à l’action : soyez une personne pleine d’initiative (Compétences clés)
description:
This workshop will help you gauge which Self-Starter behaviours are strengths for you, and which you need to develop. You will be introduced to concepts, insights, tools and tips to understand what Self-Starter means in your role, and how to demonstrate those behaviours more effectively and consistently.

HOW YOU WILL BENEFIT:

• Be valued as someone who takes initiative to make things happen

• Reduce your frustration by focusing on what’s within your control

• Overcome mental barriers to personal accountability

YOU WILL LEARN TO:

• Understand what a self-starter is and how it relates to your role

• Understand personal accountability: what it is, what it looks like, where are your gaps & strengths

• Improve your capacity to identify the optimal actions you can take in a situation

• Understand how to prioritize, plan & manage to achieve results while considering the bigger picture

• Increase your ability to be resilient in the face of challenges

title: Be A Team Player (Core Competency) / Soyez un joueur d’équipe (Compétences clés)
description:
This workshop will help you assess your current Team Player strengths and gaps. You will explore concepts and practice skills that will help you thrive, while at the same time helping your colleagues thrive. You will be equipped with tools to build trusting and collaborative relationships that produce results.

YOU WILL LEARN TO:

• Understand what being a Team Player at the Bank is and what it isn’t
• Assess your impact as a Team Player
• Learn to become a more complete Team Player
• Understand how individual styles impact communication and team dynamics
• Build more trusting relationships
• Learn about different approaches to conflict
• Identify how you can be a more effective Team Player within and beyond your team

title: CFP Course 1: Currency's Role within the Bank of Canada / PFM Formation 1: Le rôle de la monnaie au sein de la Banque du Canada
description: Currency Foundations Program Course 1. We ensure Canadians have access to adequate supplies of secure bank notes they can use with confidence and pride. We do this through research, education, compliance and quality and operations.

title: CFP Course 2:  Bank Note Development, Design and Origination / PFM Formation 2:  Conception et production des billets de banque
description: Currency Foundations Program Course 2. Significant research, artistry and technical expertise goes into designing and printing Canada’s bank notes. Currency Department teams contribute to every step of the process.

title: CFP Research in Currency / PFM Formation : La recherche dans la monnaie
description: Currency Foundations Program Course 3. We undertake a broad spectrum of research to inform the department’s strategic direction. Research topics include bank note security features and design, the use of cash and payment methods, and the future of bank notes including the potential of a central bank digital currency.

title: CFP Course 4: Bank Note Distribution and Agency Operation Centres (AOCs) / PFM Formation 4: Le Système de distribution des billets de banque et les centres des opérations des agences
description: Currency Foundations Program course 4. The Bank oversees the complex distribution system that ensures Canadians have ready access to bank notes. The Bank’s operations are a key component in the flow of cash across the country.

title: CFP Course 5: Bank Note Quality Management / PFM Formation 5: Gestion de la qualité des billets de banque
description:
We manage the supply chain to ensure all new notes procured by the Bank meet our high standards for quality. We also ensure that fit notes in circulation continue to be of high quality. Key elements of our quality regime include Single Note Inspection, the Quality Assurance Lab, the Agency Operations Centres and a bank note redemption service.

Presented by VSM, QM (QA Lab), QM (AOCs)

title: CFP Course 6: Stakeholder Engagement and Public Consultation / PFM Formation 6: Consultation et Collaboration
description: We consult regularly with stakeholders in retail, banking and the public at large to provide valuable information on topics such as how cash is being used and the visual content of future bank notes. To deter counterfeiting, we collaborate with law enforcement agencies and the judiciary and conduct educational activities to increase the routine verification of bank notes by retailers and the public. We work with domestic partners (CNIB, CBN, etc.) and participate in international working groups (Four Nations, DMST, PACRIM, etc.) and collaborate with other organizations to pool knowledge, exchange best practices and more.

title: CFP Course 7: Compliance and our Strategy to Keep Counterfeiting Low / PFM Formation 7: L’observation de la loi et notre stratégie pour garder la contrefaçon à un niveau bas
description: Achieving consistently low levels of counterfeiting is critical to maintaining confidence in bank notes. To deter counterfeiting, Currency collaborates with law enforcement and the judiciary to monitor and respond to counterfeiting threats and to minimize their impact on Canadians. Hear from the Justice System Specialist and a Regional Office representative to learn more about different initiatives – at the national and regional level – and how we engage with this important stakeholder.

title: CFP Course 8: Seigniorage & Legal Tender Status / PFM Formation 8: Seigneuriage et statut de la devise officielle
description:
We are bound by specific Acts and concepts that impact our department and our work. Seigniorage enables a central bank to generate revenue by printing and issuing bank notes while legal tender status means the Canadian government has deemed our bank notes to be the official money used in our country.

Presented by BAPD, ELS

title: COO hosted networking event / Activité de réseautage présentée par le chef de l’exploitation
description: As part of your onboarding experience, come and meet some of your new colleagues from across the Bank at this event hosted by our Chief Operating Officer, Filipe Dinis.

title: Student Orientation / Orientation des étudiants
description: Part of the Student Experience, this bilingual orientation workshop will provide you with important information as you get settled in your new work environment.  You probably want to know more about the Bank and it's culture, security awareness, compliance information and our Backpack to Briefcase program.  Not to mention you might have a number of questions on other topics which we could answer for you.

title: TEAMs familiarization session / Séance de familiarisation avec TEAM's
description:
Welcome to the Bank of Canada’s TEAM’s familiarization session

In this session you will learn how the TEAM's tool is integrated into the Bank’s electronic as well as physical environment.

Communication is very important in this day and age and we would like to make sure that you have the necessary knowledge to take advantage of all of the features that TEAM’s has to offer.

Please join me for a fun filled informative experience.

This session will be primarily in English, however I am fully bilingual and able to answer in either official language.

title: WMH: Module 1 + 2 - Classroom / Module 1 + 2 - en classe
description:
The classroom sessions are delivered in the language identified for the course you select when registering below. All other components of this mandatory training can be completed in English or French.

 

Module 1: Introduction to a Mentally Healthy Workplace

A high level introduction to the topic of mental health in the workplace. Designed to create awareness of the impact of mental health issues and serves as the foundation for building knowledge and practical skills throughout the program.

 

Module 2: The Leader’s Role in Managing a Mentally Healthy Workplace

In-depth development of leader skills by using the Mental Health Framework to look at managing prevention, early performance coaching, recovery, absence and return to work.

title: Required session on conduct of personal financial transactions | Session obligatoire sur conduite des transactions financières personnelles
description:
The Code of Business Conduct and Ethics (the Code) encompasses the Bank’s conduct and ethics policies.  An important element of the Code is the section dealing with restrictions on personal financial transactions.  The scope of restriction on trading in specific securities depends on an employee’s restriction level under the Code.  Employees in positions designated Level 1, 2, 3 or 4 are subject to enhanced trading restrictions. 

To ensure that employees understand their obligations and the trading restrictions that apply to them under the Code, the Compliance Office is holding mandatory education sessions on the Personal Financial Transactions section of the Code to all new employees in positions designated Level 1, 2, 3 or 4 and to all employees newly appointed to a position designated Level 1, 2, 3 or 4. 

More information about the financial restrictions that apply to you is available on Banque Centrale. 

 

**********

Le Code de conduite professionnelle et d'éthique (le Code) englobe les politiques de la Banque en matière de conduite et d'éthique. Un élément important du Code est la section traitant des restrictions sur les transactions financières personnelles.  L'étendue des restrictions sur les opérations sur des titres spécifiques dépend du niveau de restriction d'un employé en vertu du Code.  Les employés occupant des postes désignés niveau 1, 2, 3 ou 4 sont soumis à des restrictions renforcées en matière d'opérations sur titres.

Pour assurer que les employés comprennent leurs obligations et les restrictions de négociation qui leur sont applicables en vertu du Code, le Bureau de conformité organise des sessions de formation obligatoires sur la section du Code relative aux transactions financières personnelles à tous les nouveaux employés occupant des postes désignés comme étant de niveau 1, 2, 3 ou 4 et à tous les employés nouvellement nommés à un poste désigné comme étant de niveau 1, 2, 3 ou 4.

Vous trouverez plus d'informations sur les restrictions financières qui vous concernent sur Banque Centrale.

title: Selection Centrale: Benefits and Pension Info Session (Optional) / Sélection Centrale: Séance d'info sur les avantages sociaux et le régime de pension de la Banque
description:
(This session is part of the New Employee Onboarding Program)

Join Benefits & Pension Specialist, Annie Beaulieu, for this 1.5 hour bilingual info session about your upcoming benefits selections and pension questions.

During this session, you will:

- Learn about Selection Centrale, the benefits and pension tool, and enrolment process
- Find out what you should consider before making your final benefits selections
- Learn where to find further information about our Benefits a la Carte and Pension programs
- Have the Opportunity to ask our Specialist any questions you may have

title: New Employee Essentials: Part 2 / Les essentiels pour les nouveaux employés : partie​​​​​​​ 2
description:
Do you have any questions?  Perhaps other members of your cohort have the same questions you do!   As part of the New Employee Onboarding experience, this bilingual orientation workshop will provide you with the opportunity to ask questions and hear from our panel of experts, whom are joining us from many different departments within Corporate Administration.  
For the second hour, we will participate in a phishing activity facilitated by our Security Awareness team.

title: Integrating Agile and Change Management
description: Over the last decade, both Agile and change management have emerged as strategies to improve change outcomes. Organizations are now looking for approaches to integrate change management and Agile to improve the adoption and usage of iteratively designed solutions. In this innovative one-day workshop, explore the latest research and build specific tactics and plans for adapting change management to Agile iterative development. Learn about the best practices and frameworks for applying change management in an Agile environment.

title: Foundational Virtual Facilitation Skills Course / Cours de base sur les compétences en facilitation virtuelle
description:
Learn how to effectively facilitate meetings and workshops in a virtual setting. Sign up for foundational and advanced training offered by the Facilitators Community of Practice. 


	Roles and responsibilities in Facilitation 
	Group facilitation principles 
	How to create engaging and productive remote experiences 
	Establish purpose and design with intention 
	Creative basis for generating ideas 
	Core virtual facilitation tools and techniques 
	Preparing the virtual learning/meeting environment 


Dates: October 12, 18, 19 & 21, from 8:30AM to 12:00PM

Workshops are capped at 20 participants. This is not a corporate offering – make sure to speak to your manager about the costs involved before registering.

The registration is a two-step process.  Prior to registering you need to complete the Chargeback Cost form and enter in your Cost Centre.  Once submitted the Course Registration tab will become active and you can register.

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Geneviève Prasow.

title: Advanced Virtual Facilitation Skills Course / Compétences avancées en matière de facilitation virtuelle
description:
Advanced Virtual Facilitation Skills

Facilitative Behaviours 
The art of advocacy and inquiry 
Group development and team dynamics 
Facilitate group decisions and testing for consensus 
Dealing with conflict and managing participation 
Strategic Planning methodology 


Dates : October 12 & 18 from 1PM to 4:30PM

Workshops are capped at 20 participants. This is not a corporate offering – make sure to speak to your manager about the costs involved before registering.

The registration is a two-step process.  Prior to registering you need to complete the Chargeback Cost form and enter in your Cost Centre.  Once submitted the Course Registration tab will become active and you can register.

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Geneviève Prasow.

title: Storytelling: Making Better Business Connections / La narration: Établir de meilleurs relations d’affaires
description: It’s a scientific fact - our brains are hard-wired to remember facts and statistics when told through a story. Those who are great storytellers make better connections, increase employee engagement, appeal to all types of listeners (in-person and virtually), and motivate others to action. This 4.5 hour learning experience is specifically designed for Bank of Canada employees – from operations and data analysts to economists. Learners will stretch their thinking about ‘effective communication’, activate their storytelling muscles through practice, and walk away with practical tools they will use right away to make better business connections both internally and externally.

title: Elevating Your Listening Skills / Accroître votre capacité d’écoute
description:
Learn and practice the skills to engage your audience, broaden or focus the conversation, and deepen the insight and understanding. Notice when you stand in the way of your own listening and discover the questions and tools to uncover and hear what’s most important.

How Participants Will Benefit:
•	Ask powerful questions that engage and uncover insights
•	Manage your assumptions and biases to listen from the other’s perspective
•	Apply tools to validate, confirm and further your understanding

title: Ottawa Building Tours for New Employees / Visites guidées à Ottawa pour les nouveaux employés
description:
Come and check out your new digs. Our doors are open and we are ready to welcome you!

To introduce you to your new spaces and to allow you to meet a few of your new colleagues, consider joining a 90-minute guided tour of our downtown Ottawa building, located at 234 Wellington Street. 

Before your tour, please review the on-site protocols. Remember that if you are planning on working on your floor before or after your tour, you'll need to use the reservation tool to book a spot before you go.

NOTE: Security passes will be provided to all participants during their visit as part of the tour. 

We are very much looking forward to meeting you in person and showing you our beautiful facilities.

title: Passion and Experience (P/E) Career Ownership Self-Assessment Workshop / Atelier d’autoévaluation Passion et expérience (P/E) pour prendre en main sa carrière
description:
What if… you had a powerful self-assessment tool to help you gain clarity about how to own your career?

Are you looking to own your career and deepen the quality of content and clarity of direction that emerges from your career conversations with your leader? Join Innovative Facilitation for an interactive workshop that will guide you through the Passion & Experience Assessment – an online career focused self-assessment tool. During this workshop you will log into the online tool and begin to deepen your thinking about your current and desired work life.

**NOTE: If you attended the virtual Communication Skills: Be One-on-One Ready course, you have already experienced the content of this session. If you attended Communication Skills: Be One-on-One Ready in person prior to March 2020 or have not yet attended it, then be sure to join us for this career boosting workshop!

The P/E Assessment is a confidential on-line tool that will support both the leader and team members in discovering how to:
• Prepare content to enhance the quality of performance and career conversations
• Clarify desired career state
• Structure a meaningful career conversation
• Enhance professional development plans
• Boost engagement at work

******

Et si… vous disposiez d’un puissant outil d’autoévaluation qui vous aiderait à prendre en charge l’orientation de votre carrière?

Souhaitez-vous prendre en main votre carrière et optimiser la qualité du contenu de vos entretiens sur votre parcours professionnel avec votre leader et clarifier l’orientation qui en découle? Participez à un atelier interactif offert par Innovative Facilitation dans le cadre duquel vous bénéficierez de l’encadrement requis pour réaliser une évaluation « P/E » (passion et expérience) à l’aide d’un outil en ligne d’autoévaluation axée sur la carrière. Pendant la séance, vous accéderez à notre outil en ligne et commencerez à approfondir votre réflexion au sujet de votre situation professionnelle présente et souhaitée.

NOTA : Si vous avez déjà participé à la version virtuelle de l’Atelier sur les techniques de communication : Soyez prêt pour vos rencontres individuelles, vous connaissez déjà le contenu de ce programme. Si vous y avez assisté en personne avant mars 2020 ou si vous n’y avez jamais participé, alors cette séance sur l’optimisation de votre carrière est faite pour vous!

L’évaluation P/E est un outil en ligne confidentiel qui aidera les leaders et les membres de leurs équipes découvrir comment :


	se préparer aux entretiens sur le rendement et le perfectionnement professionnel pour en améliorer la qualité
	clarifier ses aspirations professionnelles
	préparer des entretiens constructifs sur la carrière
	optimiser ses plans de perfectionnement professionnel
	relever son niveau de motivation au travail

title: Income Taxes and How To Minimize / Les impôts et les stratégies pour les réduire
description:
You know the saying, “In this world, nothing can be said to be certain except death and taxes.” Benjamin Franklin. Unfortunately, many Canadian taxpayers end up paying more in tax than is necessary. This webinar will help you understand the importance and the mechanics of proper tax planning by educating you on proper tax minimizing strategies and mechanisms including understanding the difference between marginal rates and effective rates, utilizing common tax deductions and tax credits and evaluating family tax planning strategies including income splitting.

In this webinar, we’ll cover:
• Overview of Canada’s income tax system
• Basics of income tax filing
• Common tax deductions and tax credits
• Income splitting strategies that couples can use

*****

Comme le disait si bien Benjamin Franklin : « En ce monde rien n'est certain, à part la mort et les impôts. » Malheureusement, de nombreux contribuables canadiens finissent par payer plus d'impôts que nécessaire. Grâce à ce webinaire, vous comprendrez l'importance d'une bonne planification fiscale en vous initiant aux stratégies et mécanismes appropriés de réduction de l’impôt sur le revenu, notamment la différence entre les taux marginaux et les taux effectifs d’imposition, l'utilisation des déductions fiscales et crédits d'impôt habituels et l'évaluation des stratégies de planification fiscale familiale, y compris le fractionnement du revenu.

Au programme :


	Aperçu du système d’imposition canadien
	Bases de la déclaration de revenus
	Déductions fiscales et crédits d'impôt habituels 
	Stratégies de fractionnement du revenu entre conjoints

title: QRIO Demo / Démonstration QRIO
description: Learn how to get started in Qrio – the Bank’s new learning experience platform.  This hands-on demo will cover how to discover, search and share all of the learning and development resources available at your fingertips.

title: Thriving in Hybrid / Prospérer dans l'hybride
description:
Do you have the skills to collaborate effectively and stay productive and engaged while working in a hybrid environment?

If you’re new to working on a hybrid team or simply unsure of how to adapt your approach for greater effectiveness in a hybrid workplace, then this course is for you. We’ll provide you with the context, clarity, insights and tactics necessary to demystify working effectively on a Hybrid Team.

Specifically, this course will increase your comfort in working in a hybrid environment as you engage with your colleagues and leader in contributing positively to this way of working. This 2-hour webinar will help you craft a vision of what effective hybrid work looks like, for you and for your organization, as you very deliberately identify and develop strategies that will help you to thrive.

Learning Objectives

• Understand what makes a GREAT Hybrid Team
• Recognize what you need to maximize your productivity and effectiveness in a hybrid environment
• Articulate a vision for how you as an individual contributor can support your hybrid team
• Lead and contribute to more effective, engaged, and inclusive hybrid team meetings

title: Backpack to Briefcase: Ottawa Building Tour for Students / Tremplin carrière: visite guidée à Ottawa pour les étudiants
description:
To introduce you to your new spaces and to allow you to meet a few of your new colleagues, consider joining a 90-minute guided tour of our downtown Ottawa building, located at 234 Wellington Street. 

Before your tour begins, join us in the IdeaSpace for some light refreshments as well as an opportunity to get a headshot photo taken, which you could use for your LinkedIn profile. 

We ask you to please review the on-site protocols. 

NOTE: Security passes will be provided to all participants during their visit as part of the tour. 

We are very much looking forward to meeting you in person and showing you our beautiful facilities.

title: Introduction to using MS Teams at the Bank / Introduction à l’utilisation de MS Teams à la Banque
description:
Welcome to an introduction to using MS TEAMS at the Bank! 

Effective communication is essential in a hybrid work model and knowing how to use some of the basic features of MS TEAMS will help. 
 
In this session, you will learn about some of these features and how we use them at the Bank.  

We’ll cover:
•	How to set up an MS TEAMS meeting
•	How to join an MS TEAMS meeting
•	How to connect your audio and video devices to an MS TEAMS meeting
•	Meeting buttons and what they do
•	Making an audio call in MS TEAMS
•	How to include everyone effectively in MS TEAMS

Please join us for an engaging and interactive session to help you get started on MS TEAMS and make the most of your virtual meeting experience!

title: Great Meetings @ The Bank / Les réunions formidables à la Banque
description: Come to this interactive session to discover how you can make meetings great, even when you're not the facilitator!

title: Rock your LinkedIn Profile / Créer un profil LinkedIn efficace
description:
The intention of this virtual session is to uncover the breadth of LinkedIn.
No matter what type of job you do or your knowledge of the platform (or social media broadly), this session will provide you with some tips for how you can use LinkedIn to build a professional identity, network with others, keep a pulse on industry or company-specific news, or use it as a platform to share your thoughts or pass along relevant articles to your network.

This virtual session will be interactive and will go beyond profile tips (although those will be included).

title: Ready to Retire / Prêt pour la retraite
description: The focus of the 1-day 'Ready to Retire' virtual seminar  will be on financial planning. This seminar is aimed to those who are within 2 years of retirement, are members of the Bank's Pension Plan and have already attended the comprehensive Retirement Planning seminar. Please consult with your supervisor before registering.

title: Retirement Planning / Planification de la retraite
description: The focus of 2-day comprehensive virtual seminar will be on financial and lifestyle planning including estate planning, health and psychological aspects of retirement planning. This session is aimed to those employees who are within 10 years of retirement and who are members of the Bank’s Pension Plan . Please consult with your supervisor before registering.

title: About the Bank of Canada/À propos de la Banque du Canada
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Identify the Bank's mandate
	Describe our four core functions
	List the departments of the Bank
	Identify the two principal acts of our legal framework


____________________________________________________________

   À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de :


	définir le mandat de la Banque
	décrire ses quatre grandes fonctions
	nommer les départements de la Banque
	préciser les deux grandes lois qui constituent son cadre juridique

title: Core Function - Monetary Policy/Introduction à la politique monétaire
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Describe the Bank's monetary policy framework
	Explain why the Bank sets a target for the overnight rate
	Identify who sets the inflation-control target
	Define the operating band
	Explain how the Bank encourages financial institutions to lend at the overnight rate


________________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure :


	de décrire le cadre de conduite de la politique monétaire de la Banque
	d’expliquer pourquoi la Banque établit un taux cible du financement à un jour
	de déterminer qui fixe la cible de maîtrise de l’inflation
	de définir la fourchette opérationnelle
	d’expliquer comment la Banque encourage les institutions financières à prêter au taux du financement à un jour

title: Core Function - Financial System/Introduction à la fonction Système financier
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to understand how the Bank promotes Canada's economic and financial welfare through:


	Providing liquidity to the financial system
	Overseeing designated financial market infrastructures
	Conducting and publishing analyses and research
	Developing and implementing financial system policy in collaboration with other regulators


_______________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de comprendre comment la Banque promeut la prospérité économique et financière du Canada en:


	offrant des mécanismes de liquidité au système financier
	assurant la surveillance des infrastructures de marchés financiers désignées
	effectuant et publiant des analyses et des recherches
	élaborant et mettant en œuvre des politiques relatives au système financier avec d’autres autorités de réglementation

title: Core Function - Currency/Présentation de la fonction Monnaie
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Identify the Bank's main areas of responsibility under its Currency Function
	Describe the Bank's core Currency mandate and strategy
	List and describe the business lines of the Currency Function
	Understand how the Bank issues new bank notes and list the key partners and stakeholders involved
	Locate the Agency Operations Centres and describe their responsibilities


You may also be interested in the module About the Currency Department

_______________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de :


	nommer les principales responsabilités de la Banque qui incombent à la fonction Monnaie
	décrire le mandat premier et la stratégie de la Banque relativement à la fonction Monnaie
	énumérer et décrire les secteurs d’activité de la fonction Monnaie
	comprendre comment la Banque émet de nouveaux billets de banque et nommer les partenaires et parties prenantes clés concernés
	situer les centres des opérations des agences et décrire leurs responsabilités


Il existe également un module Présentation du département de la Monnaie

title: Core Function - Funds Management/Introduction à la gestion financière
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Define the Bank of Canada's funds management function
	Explain the Bank's fiscal agent responsibilities towards the Government of Canada
	Identify the Bank's main types of clients
	List the types of services the Bank provides to clients
	Explain the importance of funds management


_______________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure :


	de définir la fonction Gestion financière de la Banque du Canada
	d’expliquer les responsabilités de la Banque en tant qu’agent financier de l’État
	de discerner les principaux types de clients de la Banque
	d’énumérer les types de services que la Banque offre aux clients
	d’expliquer l’importance de la gestion financière

title: Banking and Payments Department (BAP) / Département des Opérations bancaires et des paiements (OBP)
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Identify BAP's main areas of responsibility and describe its key operations
	List and describe the different teams in BAP


Recommended Prerequisite: About the Bank

_______________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure :


	Nommer les grandes sphères de responsabilité des OBP et décrire leurs principales activités
	Énumérer et décrire les différentes équipes des OBP


Préalable recommandé : À propos de la Banque du Canada

title: Business Systems Support at the Bank/Soutien des systèmes opérationnels à la Banque
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Define the three Business Systems Support specialties: Business Systems Support, Business Analysis and Business Architecture
	Describe the main responsibilities of each specialty
	Explain why each specialty's work is important to the conduct of financial market and banking operations at the Bank of Canada


Recommended Prerequisite: About the Bank

_____________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce cours, vous serez en mesure :


	de définir le soutien des systèmes opérationnels, l’analyse des opérations et l’architecture opérationnelle

	d’expliquer en quoi le travail de chaque spécialité est important pour la conduite des opérations sur les marchés financiers et des opérations bancaires à la Banque du Canada


 Préalable recommandé : À propos de la Banque du Canada

title: Business Systems Support in FMD/Soutien des systèmes opérationnels aux MFI
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Define the roles of Business System Support in FMD
	Identify the main aspects of Business System Support
	Identify the main internal clients of Business System Support
	Describe the support model in FMD


Recommended Prerequisites: About the Bank, About FMD, Business Systems Support at the Bank 

________________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de :


	définir le rôle de l’équipe du Soutien des systèmes opérationnels au département des Marchés financiers
	discerner les aspects fondamentaux du soutien des systèmes opérationnels
	nommer les principaux clients internes de l’équipe
	décrire le modèle de soutien du département


Préalables recommandés : À propos de la Banque du Canada, Présentation du département des Marchés financiers, Soutien des systèmes opérationnels et analyse des opérations à la Banque

title: Government of Canada's Fiscal Agent/Agent financier du gouvernement du Canada
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Understand the roles of the Bank of Canada, the Minister of Finance, and the Department of Finance in the management of the Government's financial assets and liabilities
	Understand the Bank's responsibilities as the Government's fiscal agent


Recommended Prerequisite: Core Function - Funds Management

____________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de :


	comprendre le rôle de la Banque du Canada, du ministre des Finances et du ministère des Finances dans la gestion des actifs et passifs financiers du gouvernement
	saisir les responsabilités de la Banque à titre d’agent financier du gouvernement.


Préalable recommandé : Introduction à la gestion financière

title: Government of Canada's Banker/Le banquier du gouvernement du Canada
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Explain the role of the Government's banker at the Bank of Canada
	Identify and describe the roles of the various stakeholders involved in the management of public monies
	Describe the banking services for domestic and foreign operations
	Understand the impact of the membership of Government of Canada on various international financial institutions


Recommended Prerequisites: Core Function - Funds Management, Government of Canada's Fiscal Agent

This module is a quick reference guide; it does not include voice-over narration.

________________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure :


	d’expliquer le rôle que joue la Banque du Canada à titre de banquier du gouvernement
	de déterminer et décrire les rôles des diverses parties prenantes concernées par la gestion des fonds publics
	de décrire les services bancaires pour les opérations exécutées au pays et à l’étranger
	de comprendre l’incidence de l’adhésion du gouvernement du Canada à différents groupes d’organismes financiers internationaux


Préalables recommandés : Introduction à la gestion financière, Agent financier du gouvernement du Canada

Ce module est un aide-mémoire; il ne comprend pas de narration.

title: Banking Services to Clients/Les services bancaires offerts aux clients
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Identify the type of banking services that are offered
	Understand who the Bank's clients are
	Describe client account agreements


Recommended Prerequisite: Core Function - Funds Management

________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de :


	déterminer le type de services bancaires offerts
	comprendre qui sont les clients de la Banque
	décrire les ententes de compte client.


Préalable recommandé : Introduction à la gestion financière

title: Unclaimed Balances/Soldes non réclamés
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Define unclaimed balances (UB)
	Describe the Bank's role in handling UB's
	Describe the high-level process for claiming UB's
	Describe the high-level process for processing UB's


Recommended Prerequisite: Core Function - Funds Management

This module is a quick reference guide; it does not include voice-over narration.

________________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de :   


	définir les soldes non réclamés
	décrire le rôle de la Banque dans le traitement des soldes non réclamés
	décrire le processus général de demande de remboursement d’un solde non réclamé
	décrire le processus général de traitement des soldes non réclamés


Préalable recommandé : Introduction à la gestion financière


Ce module est un aide-mémoire; il ne comprend pas de narration.

title: Settlement Balances/Soldes de règlement
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Understand how adjusting settlement balances helps achieve the Bank's objectives
	Recall how the settlement balance target is determined and who sets it
	Explain how the target level is achieved
	Identify the difference between target levels and actual levels


Recommended Prerequisite: Core Function - Monetary Policy

_____________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure :  


	de comprendre en quoi l’ajustement des soldes de règlement aide la Banque à atteindre ses objectifs
	d savoir qui fixe le niveau cible des soldes de règlement et comment
	d’expliquer comment le niveau cible est atteint
	de faire la différence entre le niveau cible et le niveau réel


Préalable recommandé : Introduction à la politique monétaire

title: The Automated Clearing Settlement System/Système automatisé de compensation et de règlement
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Define the ACSS and explain its purpose
	Define the requirements to be direct and indirect clearers
	Describe the ACSS clearing and settlement cycle
	Describe the risk control mechanisms in place for the ACSS
	Identify the difference between the ACSS and Lynx, and explain how the two are related


Recommended Prerequisites: Core Function - Monetary Policy, Settlement Balances

________________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de :


	définir le SACR et d’expliquer à quoi il sert
	définir les exigences à remplir pour être un adhérent ou un sous-adhérent
	décrire le cycle de compensation et de règlement du SACR
	décrire les mécanismes de contrôle des risques prévus dans le cadre du SACR
	reconnaître la différence entre le SACR et Lynx, ainsi que d’expliquer en quoi les deux systèmes sont liés


Préalables recommandés : Introduction à la politique monétaire, Soldes de règlement

title: Facilities Supporting the Operating Band/Mécanismes soutenant la fourchette opérationnelle
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Describe the mechanics of the operating band
	Understand the facilities that support the operating band (SLF, OR/ORR, Overnight Standing Repo Facility, Collateral Policy)


Recommended Prerequisites: Core Function - Monetary Policy, Settlement Balances

__________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de :


	décrire le fonctionnement de la fourchette opérationnelle
	comprendre les mécanismes qui soutiennent cette fourchette

title: Unconventional Monetary Policy/Politique monétaire non traditionnelle
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Describe the framework for conducting monetary policy at low interest rates
	Identify the four extraordinary measures that the Bank can use when interest rates are very low


Recommended Prerequisite: Core Function - Monetary Policy

________________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure de :


	décrire le cadre de conduite de la politique monétaire en contexte de bas taux d’intérêt,
	nommer les quatre mesures exceptionnelles que la Banque peut prendre lorsque les taux d’intérêt sont très bas


Préalables recommandés : Introduction à la politique monétaire

title: Fixed Announcement Date Cycle/Cycle des dates d’annonce préétablies
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Understand how the Bank prepares for FADs
	Understand the FAD cycle
	Understand the Bank's communication and trading blackout periods


Recommended Prerequisite: Core Function - Monetary Policy

________________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous comprendrez :


	comment la Banque du Canada se prépare en vue des dates d’annonce préétablies
	le cycle des dates d’annonce préétablies en tant que tel
	les périodes de restriction des communications et d’interdiction de négociation entourant ces dates


Préalable recommandé : Introduction à la politique monétaire

title: Debt Management/Gestion de la dette
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Explain the Government's strategy in managing its debt
	Understand the governance structure
	Understand how the domestic borrowing program is developed
	Describe the debt distribution framework


Recommended Prerequisites: Core Function - Funds Management, Government of Canada's Fiscal Agent

_______________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure :


	d’expliquer la stratégie du gouvernement pour gérer sa dette

	de décrire le cadre de distribution des titres destinés aux investisseurs institutionnels


Préalables recommandés : Introduction à la gestion financière, Agent financier du gouvernement du Canada

title: Retail Debt Management/Gestion des titres au détail
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Explain the role of the Bank as it relates to Retail Debt
	Recall the history of the Canada Savings Bonds Program
	Explain why the Government stopped issuing Canada Savings Bond
	Identify the services the Bank of Canada still offers to Canada Savings Bond and Canada Premium Bond holders

________________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure :


	d’expliquer le rôle de la Banque en matière de placement des titres au détail
	de connaître l’histoire du programme des Obligations d’épargne du Canada

title: Services to Foreign Entities/Banques centrales et organismes financiers internationaux
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:

	reconnaître les avantages des services offerts

title: Banking Services to Crown Corporations/Sociétés d'État
description:

_____________________________________________________________

title: Financial Market Infrastructures/Infrastructures de marchés financiers

After completing this module, you will be able to:

	Understand the services the Bank offers to FMIs


Recommended Prerequisite: Core Function - Financial System

______________________________________________________________

After completing this module, you will be able to:

	de reconnaître les principaux types d’actifs et de passifs du CFC

title: Management of Exchange Fund Account Assets/Gestion des actifs du Compte du fonds des changes
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:

	Identify eligible currencies
	Define the different classes of assets and asset issuers
	Identify the high-level framework for managing EFA assets
	Explain the purpose of the Investment and Funding Plan


Recommended Prerequisites: Core Function - Funds Management, Government of Canada's Fiscal Agent, Canada's Official International Reserves

_______________________________________________________________

À la fin de ce module, vous serez en mesure :


	d’expliquer la finalité et les objectifs de la gestion des actifs détenus dans le CFC

title: Government of Canada Securities/Titres du gouvernement du Canada
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Understand the importance of Government of Canada securities
	Identify the main types of securities
	Describe the market structure
	Identify the objectives of debt management
	Explain the Primary Dealers' responsibilities and associated benefits
	Describe the auction process


Recommended Prerequisites: Core Function - Funds Management, Government of Canada's Fiscal Agent, Wholesale Debt Management

_____________________________________________________________

	de comprendre l’importance des titres du gouvernement du Canada
	de discerner les principaux types de titres

	de définir les objectifs de la gestion de la dette
	d’expliquer les responsabilités des négociants principaux et les avantages connexes

title: Government of Canada Bond Buyback Operations/Opérations de rachat d’obligations du gouvernement

After completing this module, you will be able to:

	Identify the objectives of the Regular Bond Buyback Program and the Cash Management Bond Buyback Program

title: The Bank's Balance Sheet/Le bilan de la Banque
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Define the purpose of the Bank's balance sheet

____________________________________________________________

	d’expliquer la finalité, les objectifs et la gouvernance de la gestion de la trésorerie

title: Securities Purchases and Term Repos/Achat de titres et opérations de pension à plus d’un jour
description:
After completing this module, you will be able to:


	Recall the Bank's reasons for purchasing assets

	d’énumérer les raisons pour lesquelles la Banque achète des titres

title: Repurchase Agreements/Opérations de pension

	d’expliquer l’utilité des opérations de pension
	de nommer les principaux éléments d’une convention de pension et

title: Central Counterparties/Contreparties centrales

After completing this module, you will be able to:

title: Providing Market-Wide Liquidity in Extraordinary Circumstances/Octroi de liquidités extraordinaires

title: Foreign Exchange Intervention/Interventions sur le marché des changes
